Key Arguments: The legislation is intended to silence free speech and shut down debate.
The government and mainstream media have been sources of misinformation, particularly regarding COVID-19.
The Prime Minister has spread misinformation, exemplified by the Uluru Statement claim.
The bill undermines critical thinking and treats Australians as incapable of discernment.
The legislation represents government overreach and is akin to censorship in authoritarian regimes.
Notable Quotes: This is a particularly dangerous piece of legislation.
Who chooses the arbiters of truth? What qualifies them to decide what is fact, and what is mis/disinformation?
This draconian bill is a step too far. It is something we might expect in Communist dictatorships, but it is unacceptable government overreach in a supposedly free, democratic society.
